question: In a high by-pass engine with a ‘pitot’ intake, with the engine running and the brakes on, what will P1 be in relation to P0?

choices.choice: Same
Greater
Less
14.7psi

subject: Technical

question: A pitot intake forms a ____________ duct______ the fan to ensure that the airflow ______ to ________ and achieves a ________

choices.choice: convergent before speeds up subsonic pressure rise
divergent after slows down subsonic pressure rise
divergent before speeds up sonic pressure drop
divergent before slows down subsonic pressure rise

subject: Technical

question: What effect will severe icing in the intake have on a high by-pass engine?

choices.choice: The axial velocity of the air will increase with a reduction in the angle of attack of the airflow with the compressor blades and a possible stall.
The axial velocity of the air will decrease with a reduction in the angle of attack of the airflow with the compressor blades and a possible stall.
The axial velocity of the air will decrease with an increase in the angle that the resultant airflow forms with the compressor blades chord line and a possible stall.
The axial velocity of the air will increase with an increase in the angle of attack of the airflow with the compressor blades and a possible stall.

subject: Technical

question: Which of the following would be classed as prudent when carrying out Engine Ground Runs?

choices.choice: Only carry out engine runs with a tail wind
Fit debris guards when running
Only do ground runs on Tarmac
Only do ground runs on concrete

subject: Technical

question: With an ‘S’ type intake, if the pilot selects max RPM while standing still, there is a strong possibility that:

choices.choice: The angle, which the relative airflow forms with the compressor blades, will become too small, which will cause the engine to stall and surge.
The angle, which the relative airflow forms with the compressor blades, will become too small, which will cause the engine to surge then stall.
The angle which the relative airflow forms with the compressor blades will become too large, which will cause the engine to stall and surge.
The angle, which the relative airflow forms with the compressor blades, will become too large, which will cause the engine to surge then stall.

subject: Technical

question: Secondary air inlet doors are utilised:

choices.choice: When an aircraft is in the cruise
When the aircraft is near its maximum IAS.
When the rpm of the engine is low while stationary.
When the rpm of the engine is high when stationary

subject: Technical

question: What is the purpose of the supersonic diffuser in the variable throat intake?

choices.choice: Final reduction in velocity prior to compressor face.
Interim reduction in velocity to below Mach 1 prior to a further reduction in the subsonic diffuser.
Interim reduction in velocity to below Mach .5 prior to a further reduction in the subsonic diffuser.
Increase in velocity prior to compressor face.

subject: Technical

question: The purpose of an air inlet is to provide a relatively ________ supply of air to the ________ of the ________ compressor.

choices.choice: turbulent free face low pressure
turbulent face low pressure
turbulent free rear low pressure
turbulent free face high pressure

subject: Technical

question: In a pitot intake the term ‘Ram Pressure Recovery’ refers to the time when:

choices.choice: EPR has attained the take off setting.
The HP Compressor has reached its maximum.
The EPR has recovered to its optimum figure.
Intake pressure has been re-established to ambient pressure.

subject: Technical

question: The effect on EPR with an iced up P1 probe with the RPM of the engine increasing

choices.choice: EPR would decrease.
No change.
EPR would momentarily decrease then increase.
EPR would increase.

subject: Technical
